issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) require a constructor that initializes attributes in the UML order: lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors. The reference solution's constructor signature uses a different parameter order: (String lectureName, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents). This mismatch between the specified constructor order and the implemented constructor signature can confuse students about the expected parameter order and will likely cause constructor-related tests (which expect the UML order) to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor signature in the solution (and template if provided) follow the UML-specified attribute order. Change the constructor to: public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) and assign parameters to the corresponding fields. Alternatively, if a different order was intended, update the problem statement and UML to reflect that order so all artifacts are consistent.
